Eric wrote:
> Is there a reason the CrawlOrder MBean attributes aren't writable?
>   
Most attributes are writeable.  Is your experience otherwise?


> It'd be really nice for those of us that want to script heritrix to
> load up an order (especially based on a recovery), then be able to
> modify it using JMX before launching the crawl.
>
> eric.
>
>   
As is, there are limits.  You can't add/remove modules (e.g. decide 
rules) nor add overrides via JMX but we intend to fix this in the 
release after the pending one.

You can add a new job based on a jar that includes an order and seeds 
(and possibly overrides).  You could do desired macro edits on an 
order.xml template and then post the bundle to a remote crawler to 
execute on (Micro changes could be done by changing attributes via JMX 
-- though again, you can't get at attributes in overrides).

St.Ack
